00035 template<typename T, bool isNumber> struct getMinMaxImpl { // fallback for unsupportet types
00036     std::pair<T, T> operator()( const ValuePtr<T> &/*ref*/ ) const {
00037         LOG( Debug, error ) << "min/max computation of " << util::Value<T>::staticName() << " is not supportet";
00038         return std::pair<T, T>();
00039     }
00040 };
00041 template<typename T> std::pair<T, T> calcMinMax( const T *data, size_t len )
00042 {
00043     std::pair<T, T> result( data[0], data[0] );
00044     LOG( Runtime, verbose_info ) << "using generic min/max computation for " << util::Value<T>::staticName();
00045 
00046     while ( --len ) {
00047         if ( result.second < data[len] )result.second = data[len];
00048 
00049         if ( result.first > data[len] )result.first = data[len];
00050     }
00051 
00052     return result;
00053 }
00054 
00055 #ifdef __SSE2__
00056 
00057 // specialize calcMinMax for (u)int(8,16,32)_t /
00059 
00060 template<> std::pair< uint8_t,  uint8_t> calcMinMax( const  uint8_t *data, size_t len );
00061 template<> std::pair<uint16_t, uint16_t> calcMinMax( const uint16_t *data, size_t len );
00062 template<> std::pair<uint32_t, uint32_t> calcMinMax( const uint32_t *data, size_t len );
00063 
00064 template<> std::pair< int8_t,  int8_t> calcMinMax( const  int8_t *data, size_t len );
00065 template<> std::pair<int16_t, int16_t> calcMinMax( const int16_t *data, size_t len );
00066 template<> std::pair<int32_t, int32_t> calcMinMax( const int32_t *data, size_t len );
00067 #endif //__SSE2__
00068 
00069 template<typename T> struct getMinMaxImpl<T, true> { // generic minmax for numbers (this _must_ not be run on empty ValuePtr)
00070     std::pair<T, T> operator()( const ValuePtr<T> &ref ) const {
00071         return calcMinMax( &ref[0], ref.getLength() );
00072     }
00073 };

00085 template<typename TYPE> class ValuePtr: public _internal::ValuePtrBase
00086 {
00087     boost::shared_ptr<TYPE> m_val;
00088     template<typename T> ValuePtr( const util::Value<T>& value ); // Dont do this
00089 protected:
00090     ValuePtrBase *clone() const {
00091         return new ValuePtr( *this );
00092     }
00094     class DelProxy : public boost::shared_ptr<TYPE>
00095     {
00096     public:
00102         DelProxy( const ValuePtr<TYPE> &master ): boost::shared_ptr<TYPE>( master ) {
00103             LOG( Debug, verbose_info ) << "Creating DelProxy for " << this->get();
00104         }
00106         void operator()( TYPE *at ) {
00107             LOG( Debug, verbose_info )
00108                     << "Deletion for " << this->get() << " called from splice at offset "   << at - this->get()
00109                     << ", current use_count: " << this->use_count();
00110             this->reset();//actually not needed, but we keep it here to keep obfuscation low
00111         }
00112     };
00113 public:
00114     static const unsigned short staticID = util::_internal::TypeID<TYPE>::value << 8;
00116     struct NonDeleter {
00117         void operator()( TYPE *p ) {
00118             //we have to cast the pointer to void* here, because in case of u_int8_t it will try to print the "string"
00119             LOG( Debug, info ) << "Not freeing pointer " << ( void * )p << " (" << ValuePtr<TYPE>::staticName() << ") ";
00120         };
00121     };
00123     struct BasicDeleter {
00124         void operator()( TYPE *p ) {
00125             //we have to cast the pointer to void* here, because in case of u_int8_t it will try to print the "string"
00126             LOG( Debug, verbose_info ) << "Freeing pointer " << ( void * )p << " (" << ValuePtr<TYPE>::staticName() << ") ";
00127             free( p );
00128         };
00129     };
00131     struct ObjectArrayDeleter {
00132         void operator()( TYPE *p ) {
00133             //we have to cast the pointer to void* here, because in case of u_int8_t it will try to print the "string"
00134             LOG( Debug, info ) << "Deleting object array at " << ( void * )p << " (" << ValuePtr<TYPE>::staticName() << ") ";
00135             delete[] p;
00136         };
00137     };
00144     ValuePtr( size_t length ): _internal::ValuePtrBase( length ) {
00145         if( length )
00146             m_val.reset( ( TYPE * )calloc( length, sizeof( TYPE ) ), BasicDeleter() );
00147 
00148         LOG_IF( length == 0, Debug, warning ) << "Creating an empty ValuePtr of type " << util::MSubject( staticName() ) << " you should overwrite it with a usefull pointer before using it";
00149     }
00150 
00160     ValuePtr( TYPE *const ptr, size_t length ): _internal::ValuePtrBase( length ), m_val( ptr, BasicDeleter() ) {}
00161 
00172     template<typename D> ValuePtr( TYPE *const ptr, size_t length, D d ):
00173         _internal::ValuePtrBase( length ), m_val( ptr, d ) {}
00174 
00175     virtual ~ValuePtr() {}

00181     const boost::weak_ptr<void> getRawAddress()const {
00182         return boost::weak_ptr<void>( m_val );
00183     }

00186     void copyFromMem( const TYPE *const src, size_t _length ) {
00187         LOG_IF( _length > getLength(), Runtime, error )
00188                 << "Amount of the elements to copy from memory (" << _length << ") exceeds the length of the array (" << getLength() << ")";
00189         TYPE &dest = this->operator[]( 0 );
00190         LOG( Debug, info ) << "Copying " << _length *sizeof( TYPE ) << " bytes from " << ValuePtr<TYPE>::staticName() << src << " to " << getTypeName() << &dest;
00191         memcpy( &dest, src, _length * sizeof( TYPE ) );
00192     }
00194     void copyToMem( size_t start, size_t end, TYPE *const dst )const {
00195         assert( start <= end );
00196         const size_t _length = end - start + 1;
00197         LOG_IF( end >= getLength(), Runtime, error )
00198                 << "End of the range (" << end << ") is behind the end of this ValuePtr (" << getLength() << ")";
00199         const TYPE &source = this->operator[]( start );
00200         memcpy( dst, &source, _length * sizeof( TYPE ) );
00201     }
00202 
00203     size_t compare( size_t start, size_t end, const _internal::ValuePtrBase &dst, size_t dst_start ) const {
00204         assert( start <= end );
00205         size_t ret = 0;
00206         size_t _length = end - start;
00207 
00208         if ( dst.getTypeID() != getTypeID() ) {
00209             LOG( Debug, error )
00210                     << "Comparing to a ValuePtr of different type(" << dst.getTypeName() << ", not " << getTypeName()
00211                     << "). Assuming all voxels to be different";
00212             return _length;
00213         }
00214 
00215         LOG_IF( end >= getLength(), Runtime, error )
00216                 << "End of the range (" << end << ") is behind the end of this ValuePtr (" << getLength() << ")";
00217         LOG_IF( _length + dst_start >= dst.getLength(), Runtime, error )
00218                 << "End of the range (" << _length + dst_start << ") is behind the end of the destination (" << dst.getLength() << ")";
00219         const ValuePtr<TYPE> &cmp = dst.castToValuePtr<TYPE>();
00220         LOG( Debug, verbose_info ) << "Comparing " << dst.getTypeName() << " at " << &operator[]( 0 ) << " and " << &cmp[0];
00221 
00222         for ( size_t i = start; i < end; i++ ) {
00223             if ( ! ( operator[]( i ) == cmp[i] ) ) {
00224                 ret++;
00225             }
00226         }
00227 
00228         return ret;
00229     }
00230 
00232     virtual std::string toString( bool labeled = false )const {
00233         std::string ret;
00234 
00235         if ( m_len ) {
00236             const TYPE *ptr = m_val.get();
00237 
00238             for ( size_t i = 0; i < m_len - 1; i++ )
00239                 ret += util::Value<TYPE>( ptr[i] ).toString( false ) + "|";
00240 
00241             ret += util::Value<TYPE>( ptr[m_len - 1] ).toString( labeled );
00242         }
00243 
00244         return boost::lexical_cast<std::string>( m_len ) + "#" + ret;
00245     }
00247     virtual std::string getTypeName()const {
00248         return staticName();
00249     }
00251     virtual unsigned short getTypeID()const {
00252         return staticID;
00253     }
00255     static std::string staticName() {
00256         return std::string( util::Value<TYPE>::staticName() ) + "*";
00257     }

00265         return ( m_val.get() )[idx];

00268         return ( m_val.get() )[idx];

00289     std::pair<util::ValueReference, util::ValueReference> getMinMax()const {
00290         if ( getLength() == 0 ) {
00291             LOG( Debug, error ) << "Skipping computation of min/max on an empty ValuePtr";
00292             return std::pair<util::ValueReference, util::ValueReference>();
00293         } else {
00294 
00295             const std::pair<util::Value<TYPE>, util::Value<TYPE> > result = _internal::getMinMaxImpl<TYPE, boost::is_arithmetic<TYPE>::value>()( *this );
00296 
00297             return std::make_pair( util::ValueReference( result.first ), util::ValueReference( result.second ) );
00298         }
00299     }
00300 
00301     std::vector<Reference> splice( size_t size )const {
00302         if ( size >= getLength() ) {
00303             LOG( Debug, warning )
00304                     << "splicing data of the size " << getLength() << " up into blocks of the size " << size << " is kind of useless ...";
00305         }
00306 
00307         const size_t fullSplices = getLength() / size;
00308 
00309         const size_t lastSize = getLength() % size;//rest of the division - size of the last splice
00310 
00311         const size_t splices = fullSplices + ( lastSize ? 1 : 0 );
00312 
00313         std::vector<Reference> ret( splices );
00314 
00315         DelProxy proxy( *this );
00316 
00317         for ( size_t i = 0; i < fullSplices; i++ )
00318             ret[i].reset( new ValuePtr( m_val.get() + i * size, size, proxy ) );
00319 
00320         if ( lastSize )
00321             ret.back().reset( new ValuePtr( m_val.get() + fullSplices * size, lastSize, proxy ) );
00322 
00323         return ret;
00324     }
00325     //
00326     scaling_pair getScalingTo( unsigned short typeID, autoscaleOption scaleopt = autoscale )const {
00327         std::pair<util::ValueReference, util::ValueReference> minmax = getMinMax();
00328         assert( ! ( minmax.first.isEmpty() || minmax.second.isEmpty() ) );
00329         return ValuePtrBase::getScalingTo( typeID, minmax, scaleopt );
00330     }
00331 };

00337 template<typename T> bool _internal::ValuePtrBase::is()const
00338 {
00339     util::checkType<T>();
00340     return getTypeID() == ValuePtr<T>::staticID;
00341 }
